verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> of David.<WH1732> I will sing<WH7891> of mercy<WH2617> and judgment:<WH4941> to you, O LORD,<WH3068> will I sing.<WH2167>

I will behave<WH7919> myself wisely<WH7919> in a perfect<WH8549> way.<WH1870> O when<WH4970> will you come<WH935> to me? I will walk<WH1980> within<WH7130> my house<WH1004> with a perfect<WH8537> heart.<WH3824>
I will set<WH7896> no<WH3808> wicked<WH1100> thing<WH1697> before<WH5048> my eyes:<WH5869> I hate<WH8130> the work<WH6213> of them that turn<WH7750> aside;<WH7750> it shall not stick<WH1692> to me.
A fraudulent<WH6141> heart<WH3820> shall depart<WH5493> from me: I will not know<WH3045> a wicked<WH7451> person.
Whoever privately<WH5643> slanders<WH3960> his neighbor,<WH7453> him will I cut<WH6789> off: him that has an high<WH1362> look<WH5869> and a proud<WH7342> heart<WH3824> will not I suffer.<WH3201>
My eyes<WH5869> shall be on the faithful<WH539> of the land,<WH776> that they may dwell<WH3427> with me: he that walks<WH1980> in a perfect<WH8549> way,<WH1870> he shall serve<WH8334> me.
He that works<WH6213> deceit<WH7423> shall not dwell<WH3427> within<WH7130> my house:<WH1004> he that tells<WH1696> lies<WH8267> shall not tarry<WH3559> in my sight.<WH5869>
I will early<WH1242> destroy<WH6789> all<WH3605> the wicked<WH7563> of the land;<WH776> that I may cut<WH3772> off all<WH3605> wicked<WH205> doers<WH6466> from the city<WH5892> of the LORD.<WH3068>
